meanings.definition: Material that has been deposited by colluvial processes.
meanings.sent1: The colluvium covered the ground after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the colluvium to understand the soil composition.
meanings.sent3: The colluvium seemed to form a cozy blanket over the landscape.
meanings.sent4: The colluvium was like a jigsaw puzzle of earth pieces scattered around.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the colluvium felt like stepping on a soft, uneven carpet.

meanings.definition: The accumulation of rock debris at the base of a slope.
meanings.sent1: Hiking through the colluvium at the foot of the mountain was challenging.
meanings.sent2: The colluvium at the base of the cliff showed signs of recent rockfalls.
meanings.sent3: The colluvium looked like a giant rock garden at the bottom of the hill.
meanings.sent4: The colluvium resembled a pile of discarded building blocks.
meanings.sent5: The colluvium formed a natural barrier at the foot of the slope.
